dc:title:
From Union Square to Rome,
Chapter 12 - Wheat And Cockle
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Answers the question as to how she rejected Communism. In spite of Communism's good ideals and the faults of Christians, she repudiates Communism as a heresy and rejects its resort to violence in class struggle.
